categories: Category:Articles that are known by a nickname

nodes.text: "Lock" was the nickname of a clone trooper captain who served in the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars. Under the command of Jedi General Eeth Koth, he led the Jedi Master's unit. In 21 BBY, Lock was stationed aboard the Venator-class Star Destroyer Steadfast when it was attacked by General Grievous and his contingent of Separatist forces. Lock led his fellow clone troopers in an effort to repel the droid boarding party at the cruiser's airlocks. Faced with overwhelming odds, Koth ordered Lock and his troops to evacuate the vessel, much to the captain's dismay. Not long after that order, Koth was bested by Grievous and his forces when they breached the ship's bridge.

The clone trooper who adopted the nickname "Lock" was a clone of the human male bounty hunter Jango Fett, born and raised on the planet Kamino. He was created to serve in the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars, a conflict between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. He acquired the rank of Clone Captain and was assigned to Eeth Koth's unit, under the command of Jedi General and council-member Eeth Koth. In the year 21 BBY, Lock was stationed aboard the Venator-class Star Destroyer Steadfast, alongside Eeth Koth and the rest of his unit. Whilst the Steadfast was in the Saleucami system, a Separatist fleet attacked the ship. Led by Supreme Commander General Grievous aboard his Recusant-class Commerce Guild destroyer, Separatist forces boarded the Steadfast using docking tubes.

The ensuing battle saw Lock and his clone troopers forced to defend the ship's airlocks against oncoming B2-series super battle droids. Koth contacted Lock and requested an urgent report on the situation, to which the captain replied that the number of droids was too large to counter. Koth proceeded to order Lock and his troops to evacuate the vessel in escape pods, exclaiming that he would handle Grievous on the bridge. Lock protested, stressing that the droid general's forces included BX-series droid commandos, but Koth downplayed their importance and again ordered him to evacuate. Moments later, Koth and his troops were greeted by Grievous and a squad of commando droids on the bridge. The Jedi engaged Grievous in a desperate lightsaber duel, but the latter ordered his droid escort to assist and Koth was ultimately defeated and captured.

Like all clones of the human male Jango Fett, Lock stood at 1.83 meters tall. During the attack on the Steadfast, Lock recognized that he and his troops were greatly outnumbered. He protested Koth's orders and showed concern for his Jedi General's life when he announced that he would face Grievous aboard the ship's bridge.

Lock was equipped with Phase I clone trooper armor, which featured the green and yellow markings of Eeth Koth's unit. Additionally, his helmet sported a visor and an antenna was attached to his left shoulder plate. In combat, Lock wielded a DC-15A blaster carbine, a standard-issue weapon for clone troopers of the Galactic Republic.

Lock first appeared as an unidentified character in "Grievous Intrigue," the eighth episode of the canon animated series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' second season, which aired on January 1, 2010, in which he was voiced by Dee Bradley Baker. Lock was identified by name in the episode's corresponding guide, released on StarWars.com.
